value.title: DAX Fridays #215: Previous row in DAX non-accumulated values
value.excerpt: I showed you on a previous video how to get previous row using dax on an accumulated column: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLZ4KISPcZ8  In today's video we will do it for non-accumulated values!  If you need a refresher on DATEADD function, here it the explainer video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iw-WfZM9L3U

value.title: DAX Fridays #220: SELECTEDMEASURE function
value.excerpt: Now that calculation groups are making its way into Power BI desktop, it is time to cover SELECTEDMEASURE  Blog post here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/selectedmeasure  Join this channel membership to get access to all the recorded bites as they become available: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw/join

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered.  Link to Power BI file: http://gofile.me/2kEOD/jSGFzsbB3  PREVIOUS VIDEO: USERELATIONSHIP

value.title: DAX Fridays! #24: Running/ Cumulative totals (w Pareto chart)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to calculate cumulative totals or running totals with DAX/ powerpivot.  We will calculate running totals with a Date and with another column (not a date).  Link to Matt's Blog post: http://exceleratorbi.com.au/cumulative-running-total-based-on-highest-value/  Link to

value.title: DAX Fridays! #25: Wrong Grand Totals in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through why sometimes Power BI grand totals dont add up and what to do to fix it. value.title: DAX Fridays! #26: Break RANKX ties with RAND()
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how DAX RAND function works and also how to use it to break ties on the RANKX calculation to be able to create TOP X lists in Power BI.  Link to pbix file: TopN file link: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/rank-dax  Link to RANKX file: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2qzJVeYhTY

value.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
value.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create

value.excerpt: Let's go through all the count expressions available in DAX!  Here you have the keynotes for the video so you can jump to the function you want to learn:  02:44 COUNT text (#ERROR) 03:24 COUNT numbers 04:20 COUNT blanks 04:56 COUNT dates 05:36 COUNTA text 06:44 COUNTA numbers 07:27 COUNTX 09:16 COUNTAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. We will do two examples, how to substitute one value for another and how to substitute multiple values.   Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going through the DAX function KEEPFILTERS. KEEPFILTERS will remove the behaviour that CALCULATE has where it removes the filters available.  Looking for Part 1 video?  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ewjRItLlgG8  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/keepfilters-function-dax

value.title: DAX Beginners - SUM Vs SUMX in Power BI - What, When and Where?
value.excerpt: Welcome to Wed with Dax beginner series. During this episode, we will talk about two interesting DAX expressions. SUM and SUMX. We will compare both DAX expressions in detail. First, I will explain When to use SUM and when to use SUMX. We will talk about the difference between SUM and SUMX functions

value.title: How to easily compare Server Timings using DAX Studio for your Power BI dataset
value.excerpt: Want to compare changes in your Power BI dataset? Making some amazing DAX optimizations? You should look at server timings in DAX Studio.
